MouseEventCtrlKey.summary: The MouseEvent.ctrlKey read-only property is a boolean value that indicates whether the <kbd>ctrl</kbd> key was pressed or not when a given mouse event occurs.

remarks.para: On Macintosh keyboards, this key is labeled the <kbd>control</kbd> key. Also, note that on a Mac, a click combined with the <kbd>control</kbd> key is intercepted by the operating system and used to open a context menu, so ctrlKey is not detectable on click events.

MouseEventCtrlKey.value: A boolean value, where true indicates that the key is pressed, and false indicates that the key is not pressed.
